subject: Re: Running a precondition before all tests
msgSnippet: Thanks for both your suggestions. :) I will take a look at junit-addons. Leonardo. ... try ... tests ... resources). ... refactor would give rise to Vladimir s
messageBody:
Thanks for both your suggestions. :)
I will take a look at junit-addons.

Leonardo.


--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...>
wrote:
> >So said Vladimir R. Bossicard on 2003-07-15 --------------------
> >> [...] Or your own custom TestRunner (the best solution)
> >
> >if you don't want to reinvent the wheel and want a Runner that's a
> >little bit more extendable than the standard JUnit runner, you can
try
> >the JUnit-addons Runner. Not finished yet but you can run your
tests
> >with it (and define your own custom listeners and external
resources).
> >
> >I suggest that you check out the cvs version.
> >
> >Everything is available at <junit-addons.sf.net>
>
> An excellent suggestion. What you would build yourself, then
refactor would give rise to Vladimir's work, anyway.
>
> Take care.
>
>
> J. B. Rainsberger,
> President, Diaspar Software Services
> Let's write software that people understand.
